recipe.name: Pan Seared Salmon
recipe.notes: Don't know where I found this but here you go.
ingredients: 1lb salmon fillets 1 inch thick no skin
instructions: 1. Heat butter in saute pan on medium heat until bubbling.
2. Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper,
3. Place salmon in pan gently and cook for 6 minutes or until there is a crsipy crust formed. Also season with salt and pepper.
4. Turn and let cook another 4 to 6 minutes
5. Pour in 1/c cup white wine and wait 30 seconds
6. Add lemon juice, shallots and heavy cream. Cook 2 minutes
7. Remove salmon and add parsley. Cook on low until sauce thickens to desired consistency 1-4 minutes
recipe.science: the science of cooking salmon. Should reach a temperature of 140 degrees
